news.title: Delhi CM urges builders to come up with public private partnership model
news.para: Delhi's Chief Minister, Rekha Gupta, has pledged to revamp the capital in two years, inviting PPP models for infrastructure development. NAREDCO's conference highlighted the need for sustainable practices and skilled workers in the real estate sector. While the industry grew, a drop in affordable housing sales raises concerns, prompting calls for streamlined approvals and collaborative solutions.

news.title: PNB Housing Finance's CEO resigns
news.para: Girish Kousgi, the MD and CEO of PNB Housing Finance, has resigned. He will leave on October 28, 2025. The board will look for a new leader. The company's retail loan book grew. It reached ₹76,923 crore as of June 30, 2025. Gross NPA improved to 1.06%. The cost of borrowing declined. Operating expenses increased.

news.title: ED raids against Ozone Urbana Developers in homebuyers 'fraud' case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate raided Ozone Urbana Developers and its promoters in Bangalore and Mumbai, investigating allegations of defrauding home buyers of crores of rupees. The company failed to complete its Ozone Urbana project in Devanahalli Taluk by the promised 2018 deadline, leaving buyers without homes or refunds.

news.title: Godrej Properties' net profit increases by 15.34% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Godrej Properties announces a 15.34% rise in net consolidated profit for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. Profit after tax reached ₹598.80 crore. However, total income saw a slight dip. The company sold a stake in Madhuvan Enterprises. Booking value declined, but collections grew by 22%. Five new projects were added, promising future growth for Godrej Properties.

news.title: Pune: Beneficiaries of property tax discount for green building norms doubles in six years
news.para: Pune's 'green building norm property tax discount' beneficiaries have doubled in six years, raising questions about actual environmental impact. While PMC claims surprise checks, activists demand stricter compliance verification for solar and vermicomposting systems.

news.title: Zirakpur leads Mohali district in property tax collection on final day of OTS scheme
news.para: Zirakpur municipal council collected the most property tax in Mohali district. This happened because of the Punjab government's one-time settlement scheme. The council collected Rs 12.2 crore. Many property owners cleared their dues under the scheme. The council waived interest and penalties. Jagjit Singh Judge said the scheme boosted revenue. The council will now take action against tax evaders.

news.title: Holcim's sales dips 3.8% to 4.18 billion francs in Q2 2025
news.para: Holcim, the Swiss building materials giant, reported a dip in second-quarter sales due to the strong Swiss franc, which offset local currency gains. Sales fell 3.8% to 4.18 billion francs, with currency effects shaving off 267 million francs. Despite this, operating profit rose 1.2% to 955 million francs, surpassing expectations, driven by low-carbon and recycled materials.

news.title: Heidelberg Materials beats second-quarter expectations with strict cost control
news.para: Heidelberg Materials, a major cement manufacturer, announced strong second-quarter profits. The company attributes this success to strategic price adjustments and efficient cost control measures. Operating profit exceeded expectations, reaching 1.05 billion euros. Looking ahead, Heidelberg Materials maintains its full-year forecast, anticipating stabilization in the construction sector.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh government plans new housing development authorities in four cities
news.para: The UP housing department is considering establishing four new housing development authorities in Naimisharanya, Deoria, Farrukhabad, and Barabanki to promote planned urban development. This initiative aims to regulate construction with standardized bylaws and improve infrastructure, addressing concerns about perfunctory approvals by local bodies. The proposal is under evaluation, with a focus on transparent online map approvals and comprehensive city planning.

news.title: Lucknow development body to sell vacant shops on first-come-first-served basis
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority plans to sell long-vacant commercial units on a first-come-first-serve basis after failed auctions, aiming to revive spaces and generate revenue. Additionally, LDA will revise land use for 40 unclaimed plots in seven housing schemes for residential and commercial purposes. A significant budget increase of Rs 12,504.

news.title: BlackRock in talks with developers for one million sq ft office space in NCR
news.para: Blackrock Inc. is in discussions with Bharti Real Estate and DLF to lease 1 million sq ft of office space in the National Capital Region (NCR). The asset manager aims to consolidate and expand its presence, considering properties in Bharti's 'Worldmark' and DLF's 'Downtown' projects. NCR's office leasing market is strong, with significant growth in gross leasing volume.

news.title: Ludhiana: LIT banks on land pooling scheme to finish long-pending project
news.para: The Ludhiana Improvement Trust (LIT) is actively pursuing the Punjab government's land pooling scheme to revitalize its operations and establish a new residential and commercial zone in Lohara or Jaspal Bangar. Facing potential merger with the MC due to inactivity, LIT aims to develop a green industry-cum-residential housing project, acquiring at least 100 acres initially.

news.title: Ranchi: Land buyers throng registry office on eve of hike
news.para: Ranchi's district registration office experienced a surge in land registrations as buyers rushed to finalize deals before a 10% increase in land valuation took effect on August 1. The revised rates, impacting urban wards and adjoining areas, led to anxieties among buyers eager to avoid higher registration charges.

news.title: Mumbai: No takers for slum redevelopment project in Govandi
news.para: Mumbai's Govandi and Shivaji Nagar slum redevelopment project faces challenges. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's tender received no bids for these areas. Developers cite low commercial value and connectivity issues. Concerns include inadequate civic amenities and pollution. Experts highlight transparency and land reservation policies. The BMC plans to invite fresh bids for the project.

news.title: Four Cidco tender plots in Nerul sold for ₹7.65 lakh per sq metre
news.para: In Navi Mumbai, Cidco sold four Nerul plots to a developer for a record Rs 7.65 lakh per sq m. Parth Life Spaces realty group won the deal for Rs 1,500 crore. Observers attribute the high price to the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport. Concerns arise about affordability for the working class. Experts suggest builders should control land prices.

news.title: Mumbai-based Yogayatan Group raises bid for Lavasa, emerges as top bidder
news.para: Yogayatan Group has emerged as the highest bidder for the debt-laden Lavasa Corporation, increasing its bid to Rs 795 crore. This surpasses Valor Estates' previous offer, although Valor has expressed interest in upping its bid. Lenders are navigating complexities including land titles and environmental concerns in this second attempt to resolve Lavasa's insolvency after a prior plan failed.

news.title: NGT seeks fresh report on construction of illegal buildings in Noida
news.para: The National Green Tribunal is unhappy with Noida Authority's response regarding illegal constructions. The tribunal has asked the Authority to submit a new affidavit with details on individuals, properties, and locations. This includes projects like Pristine Greens and Krishna Elite Homes. The tribunal is hearing a petition about construction on agricultural land without environmental clearance.

news.title: Karnataka committed to creating policy frameworks that support real estate sector: Govt
news.para: Karnataka is dedicated to fostering a supportive environment for real estate, emphasizing integrated urban planning and infrastructure, according to Tushar Giri Nath. A CII conference highlighted the state's leading role in India's real estate growth across various sectors.

news.title: Australia house prices keep climbing but growth pace slows
news.para: Australian home prices continue to surge, reaching a new record high in July, driven by limited housing supply and strong auction clearance rates. Cotality reports a 0.6% increase nationally, bringing annual growth to 3.7%. Sydney's median house price rose to A$1.23 million.

news.title: Sri Lotus Developers IPO booked 10.34 times on day 2 of offer
news.para: Sri Lotus Developers' IPO, backed by Bollywood stars and Ashish Kacholia, was subscribed 10.34 times on its second day. The IPO, aiming to raise Rs 792 crore, will use the proceeds to invest in subsidiaries for ongoing projects and general corporate purposes. The real estate developer focuses on luxury redevelopment projects in Mumbai's western suburbs.
